name: Kate Capshaw
biography: Kathleen Sue Spielberg (n√©e Nail; born November 3, 1953), known professionally as Kate Capshaw, is an American painter and retired actress  whose portraiture work has been shown in the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery. Formerly an actress, she is best known for her portrayal of Willie Scott, an American nightclub singer and performer in Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984), directed by eventual husband Steven Spielberg. Since then, she starred in Dreamscape (1984), Power (1986), SpaceCamp (1986), Black Rain (1989), Love Affair (1994), Just Cause (1995), and The Love Letter (1999).
